description: Lenart Kova discreetly activates overlooked override codes during site visits, providing trusted neighborhood figures with instructions to manage utilities and organize labor assignments independent of BCI oversight.

Residents in several districts use the new local controls to ignore BCI scores. Community meetings result in self-run councils, and neighbors openly share food and job roles, creating pockets of self-governance.
Free zones expand as self-organized councils coordinate essentials—work, food, healthcare—by local agreement, bypassing centralized BCI assignment. Participation spreads rapidly.

As reports of successful, peaceful self-organization reach the Council, security officials demand a crackdown while Innovators push to observe these emerging assemblies. Council debates escalate, revealing deep divisions.
Thousands join citywide demonstrations celebrating the free zones, signaling mass support for the new self-rule and further eroding the authority of the Council and the BCI system.
